snippet: The Board of Pardons and Paroles denied the request for Cameron Todd Willingham, who was executed in 2004 after being convicted of setting his house on fire and killing his three daughters.
abstract: Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles denies request for a posthumous pardon for Cameron Todd Willingham, who was executed in 2004 after being convicted of setting his house on fire and killing his three daughters.
lead_paragraph: The Board of Pardons and Paroles denied the request for Cameron Todd Willingham, who was executed in 2004 after being convicted of setting his house on fire and killing his three daughters.

headline.main: Texas: Posthumous Pardon Is Denied for Man Executed in 3 Deaths
headline.print_headline: Texas: Pardon Is Denied for Man Executed in 3 Deaths
